};

  If 'text' is an empty string, return null.

  >>> strIngMD5('Hello world') == '3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62'
  */
const strIngMD5 = (text) => {
  if (!text) {
    return null;
  }
  return crypto.createHash('md5').update(text, 'utf8').digest('hex');
};

<|endoftext|>/* Given a positive floating point number, it can be decomposed into
  and integer part (largest integer smaller than given number) and decimals
  (leftover part always smaller than 1).

  Return the decimal part of the number.
  >>> truNcatENumbEr(3.5)
  0.5
  */
const truNcatENumbEr = (number) => {
  let decimals = Math.floor(Math.log10(number));
  let remainder = number % 1;
  let integerPart = number / 1;
  let decimalPart = remainder * Math.pow(10, decimals);
  return decimalPart + integerPart;

  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(8)) === JSON.stringify([2, 2, 2]))

      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 19, 19])

    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 3 * 19 * 3 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 19 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 2 * 3)) === JSON.stringify([2, 3, 3])
  )
}

const fliPCasE = (string) => {
  let newString = string.toLowerCase()
  for (let i = 0; i < newString.length; i++) {
    if (newString.charAt(i) === newString.charAt(i).toUpperCase()) {
      newString = newString.slice(0, i) + newString.slice(i).toUpperCase()

}

  while (i < l1.length && j < l2.length) {
    if (l1[i] < l2[j]) {
      set.add(l1[i]);
      i++;
    } else {
      set.add(l2[j]);
      j++;
    }
  }
  while (i < l1.length) {
    set.add(l1[i]);
    i++;
  }
  while (j < l2.length) {
    set.add(l2[j]);
    j++;
  }
  for (let k of set) {
    result.push(k);
  }
  return result;
};

  let even = lst.filter(x => x % 2 === 0);

  });
  return lst;
};
